meanings.definition: A form of opera in which the dialogue is spoken rather than sung.
meanings.sent1: The plays we watched had singspiels where the characters spoke their lines.
meanings.sent2: In singspiels, the actors talk like in a play instead of singing all the time.
meanings.sent3: During the singspiels, the audience chuckled at the actors speaking melodiously.
meanings.sent4: The singspiels transformed the stage into a world where words danced instead of melodies.
meanings.sent5: The singspiels made the theater come alive with spoken stories and lively conversations.
